channel.title: Question about a mac jar or file downloader
channel.description: How would I make my client run via a mac? My buddy can't play my jar I created on a PC

item.title: Question about a mac jar or file downloader
item.dc:creator: @uncalled_for uncalled for
item.description:
@uncalled_for wrote:

I don’t personally have a mac so I can’t really help out… However something I do know, is that make sure your cache is downloading to the user.home area, not the C Drive.
In signlink.java (Client Side) most people have the client download to the C Drive… Like s = “C:\Mycachename” make sure that this is changed to s = System.getProperty(“user.home”) + File.separator + “mycachename.zip”;
or the cache won’t be able to download, since mac doesn’t have a C Drive.

Read full topic
item.source: Question about a mac jar or file downloader

item.title: Question about a mac jar or file downloader
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

I don’t know about other mac users, but personally I just use the terminal when I need to run a jar file. Since mac treats jar files as archives, it only extracts its contents when you double click it. If you want a quick fix to get it running on mac then just create a shell script:

#!/bin/bash
java -jar client.jar
read -p 'Press enter to continue...'

If your client is shit I imagine it’ll print some errors at this point and you’ll have to go into the code to fix paths and other windows-dependent code.

Perhaps a better solution is to use java web start, although it might be a bit tricky to setup if you don’t have much experience.

Read full topic
item.source: Question about a mac jar or file downloader
